intro: Linaria haenseleri var. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate toadflax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
